intro: Blepharipappus scaber var. subcalvus, commonly known as the roughleaf blepharipappus, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as prairies and rocky soils. Its leaves are rough and hairy, giving it the common name, while its flowers are small and yellowish. The species is often found in the central and western United States.
